circumstances: The twin engine airplane departed Fort Lauderdale in the evening on a flight to the Dominican Republic. En route, while cruising by night, the crew informed ATC about the failure of all instruments. He apparently attempted to ditch the aircraft when it crashed into the sea about 20 nautical miles off Guantanamo Bay. Few debris were found floating on water and both occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
The crew became lost/disoriented following a fuel exhaustion and electrical failure during normal cruise. The following findings were reported:
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Electrical failure, 
- Navigation instruments out, 
- Ditched in international waters 20 NM south of Cuba,
- Debris recovered.
